description.narrative: Funding under this initiative provides support for Climate Change Adaptation programs in East Timor, through the United nations Development Program (UNDP), AusAID's Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Program (RWSSP) and AusAID's Seeds of life Program Phase three (SoL III). The programs are supported by the International Climate Change Adaptation Initiative (ICCAI). This initiative will: Extend the Climate Change Research and Development Advisor to develop East Timor's capacity to adapt to the potential negative impact of climate change on food security and the agriculture sector; Increase awareness within the National Directorate of Water Resources Management on the impact of climate change on water security and develop the skill to manage these risks; and build basic awareness and understanding of climate change science and impact among key stakeholders in East Timor. The total value of this initiative is $3.9 million over 5 years, starting 2008-09.
